# Introduction

-   Dataset with Diamonds. We see the differences between carat, price and cut.

# Carat and Price

```{r}
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(diamonds, aes(x=carat, y=price)) + geom_point(alpha=0.3, color="blue") + geom_smooth(method="lm", color="yellow", se=FALSE) + labs(title="Price vs Carat", x="Carat", y="Price")
```

-   Bigger Diamonds usually cost more
-   Relationship is Positive

# Price By Cut

```{r}
ggplot(diamonds, aes(x=cut, y=price, fill=cut)) + geom_boxplot(color="brown") + labs(title="Price by Cut", x="Cut", y="Price")
```

-   Cut Quality also affects the price
-   Boxplot show wide price ranges and outliers

# Summary

-   Carat is strongly linked to price.
-   Cut matters.
-   Data shows price has big variation.
